value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: #38 Change currency using a slicer - Power BI Tips & Tricks #48
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to change currencies using a slicer. The user will be able to convert sales to different currencies by choosing a currency from a slicer. The new measure that calculates the new values in the selected currency will be then formatted to the relevant currency.  To download

value.title: Bulk import data from multiple pages on a website with Power BI Desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #04
value.excerpt: Have you come across a website that has data you need but it is presented in multiple pages? Downloading page by page can be frustrating and time consuming. In this short video, I will show you how to iterate multiple pages on a website to import the data using Power BI. value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied. This function is useful for clearing filters and creating calculations on all the rows in a table.  The function ALLEXCEPT removes all filters except the ones that have
